meanings.definition: The ability to be educated or to learn.
meanings.sent1: Her educability was evident from a young age, as she quickly grasped new concepts.
meanings.sent2: The school's focus on improving students' educability has led to higher academic achievement.
meanings.sent3: The educability of the puppy was put to the test when it learned to fetch a ball.
meanings.sent4: His educability shone like a beacon in the sea of ignorance around him.
meanings.sent5: The educability of the plant was remarkable, as it adapted to different light conditions.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being educable.
meanings.sent1: The educability of the students varied, with some showing a natural aptitude for learning.
meanings.sent2: The educator focused on enhancing the educability of each child in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The educability of the robot was impressive, as it quickly learned new tasks.
meanings.sent4: Her educability was like a blank canvas waiting to be filled with knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The educability of the team was evident in their ability to adapt to new challenges.
